stories.text:
Hi everyone,

In the last few days, I started to see many founders from the US and the EU claiming they've blocked their Russian customers even though there is nothing mentioned in their policy and their terms of use.

According to this, can the Russian customers sue those founders?

What about the GDPR rules that prevent websites from tracking visitors' locations?
stories.title: The SaaS founders are blocking their Russian customers
Metaculus: Crowd-sourced predictions about the future
Russian airlines jets seized at international airports by leasing companies
Musk: Probability of Starlink being targeted is high. Please use with caution
Nemesida WAF Free – Free Nginx WAF with the Minimum Falses and WebApp

stories.text:
Can a smartphone be of any use if the internet/cell service goes down?

Most messaging apps depend on having an active internet connection. All modern phones have WiFi mesh and Bluetooth/BLE hardware capabilities, but it seems there are very few apps that use them.

The existing apps have little overlap across platforms. Bridgeify is the only one that exists on both iOS and Android (although I didn't manage to make it work between different platforms).

I'm looking for an app that could help people communicate using their iOS/Android phones without internet connection by relaying messages peer-to-peer.

If it doesn't exist, any ideas why? How would you build one?
stories.title: Ask HN: Mobile App for Emergency Communications?
